fact: A dime has 118 ridges around the edge
A dime has 118 ridges around the edge.
A dime has 118 ridges on it.
All 50 states are listed across the top of the Lincoln Memorial on the back of the $5 bill.
America once issued a 5-cent bill.
Assuming that each fold neatly overlaps its opposite side, a dollar bill can be folded only six times—seven if put into a vise. (Try it.)
Ben Franklin coined the word battery.
Folding money was invented by the Chinese, and was first made out of deerskin.
If a US coin has the letter “S” printed on it, it was minted in San Francisco; a “D” means it was made in Denver; no letter at all means it was minted in Philadelphia.
If you have three quarters, four dimes, and four pennies, you have $1.19. You also have the largest amount of money in coins without being able to make change for a dollar.
In 1060 a coin was minted in England shaped like a clover. The user could break off any of the four leaves and use them as separate pieces of currency.

Money notes are not made from paper, they are made mostly from a special blend of cotton and linen. In 1932, when a shortage of cash occurred in Tenino, Washington, USA, notes were made out of wood for a brief period.
Nine pennies weigh exactly one ounce.
On a Canadian two-dollar bill, the American flag is flying over the Parliament Building.
On an American one-dollar bill, there is an owl in the upper left-hand corner of the "1" encased in the "shield" and a spider hidden in the front upper right-hand corner.
Pocahontas appeared on the back of the $20 bill in 1875.

Some people consider the $1 bill unlucky because there are so many 13's on it: 13 stars, 13 stripes, 13 steps, 13 arrows and even an olive branch with 13 leaves on it. Of course the $1 bill is unlucky - if it was lucky it would be a $100 bill.
The Australian $5, $10, $20, $50 and $100 notes are made out of plastic.
The face of a penny can hold about thirty drops of water.
The most money ever paid for a cow in an auction was $1.3 million.
The original fifty cent piece in Australian decimal currency had around $2.00 worth of silver in it before it was replaced with a less expensive twelve sided coin.

There are 293 ways to make change for a dollar
There are 293 ways to make change for a dollar!
There are 293 ways to make change for a dollar.
There are four cars and eleven lightposts on the back of a ten-dollar bill.
US Dollar bills are made out of cotton and linen.
